front:
[砖专专转] Study: Frailty and the brain: A narrative review of functional and pathological correlates.

What was the main finding?
back:
However, the structural, functional, and pathological changes in the brain associated with frailty remain insufficiently explored

 Sciancalepore Francesco, Salemme Simone, Valletta Martina et al. (2026)
 https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/41253248/

front: [砖专专转] Based on Sciancalepore Francesco et al. (2026), what clinical practice change might be considered?
back:
Finding: Numerous MRI-based studies have shown that frailty is associated with vascular brain damage, mostly consisting of increased white matter hyperintensity volumes, and with reduced gray matter volumes

Clinical relevance: Consider this evidence when treating elderly patients with frailty-related conditions.

 Full study: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/41253248/

[住专拽驻] Study: International society of sports nutrition position stand: 尾-hydroxy-尾-methylbutyrate (HMB).

What was the main finding?
back:

front:
[ 砖 住专] Study: The impact of ageing on the structural compositions of the mucosa of human colon.

What was the main finding?
back:
In aged laboratory animals, increased mucosal permeability has been associated with overall loss of mucosal integrity, but equivalent studies have not been conducted for the human colon

 Baidoo Nicholas, Rasis Enrica De, Tahiri Dion et al. (2025)
 https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/40848414/
